subject: Law
title: Mass Incarceration Ethics
description: A fast breakdown of Mass Incarceration Ethics for builders.

hook.text: The US has 4% of the world's population but 20% of its prisoners. Is that justice‚Äîor a system failure?

buildup.text: Mass incarceration refers to the extraordinary rate of imprisonment in the US, driven by tough-on-crime policies.

discovery.text: Mandatory minimums, three-strikes laws, and the War on Drugs fueled a prison population explosion since the 1980s.

twist.text: Black Americans are imprisoned at nearly five times the rate of white Americans. The disparity is systemic.

climax.text: Reform efforts include ending cash bail, reducing mandatory minimums, and investing in alternatives to prison.

punchline.text: Locking more people up didn't make us safer. It made us question justice.

quiz.question: What percentage of the world's prisoners are in the US?
